author: The Bulletin
title: Local sports calendar
text: Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 4:56 PM By The Bulletin Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 4:56 PM BASEBALL ONGOING The Connecticut Vipers are looking for players ages 9-18. For more info, email connecticutvipers@gmail.com The CT Dirtbags are looking for players for their 13-U, 14/ 15-U, 16-U and 19-U teams. For more info or to schedule a tryout, email program director Chris Ferrante at coachferrante@yahoo.com The Connecticut Aces are looking for high school players who want to play college baseball and are 2016 or 2017 high school grads. For more info, call team administrator Jeff Hartmann at (860) 391-0400 or email Jehartmann@comcast.net Team Connecticut Baseball is looking for players 14 and 15 to compete this fall on the Underclass Showcase team. For more information contact coach Chris Pomroy at cpomroy6@yahoo.com or call (860) 449-4052. AHEAD Grand Slam Baseball will hold a six-week Winter Workout Clinic from Nov. 4 to Dec. 16 at Grand Slam Baseball. The clinic for kids ages 7-9 will run 4:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m. and for ages 10-12 will run 6:30 p.m.-8:30 p.m. Fee is $200 per player. For more information call (860) 857-1453 or email Mike Aldrich at michael.aldrich @aol.com. Shoreline Hammerheads will hold tryouts on Nov. 6 and Nov. 10 for the following: 5 p.m. (15U and 16U) and 6:45 p.m. (17U and 18U). They will also hold tryouts on Nov. 13 and Nov. 17 at 5 p.m. (9U and 10U), 6 pm., (11U and 12U) and 7 p.m. (13U and 14U). Additionally, Shoreline Baseball Academy will hold Halloween Camps from Oct. 27-30, Thanksgiving Camps from Nov. 17-20 and a Christmas Camp from Dec. 28-31. For more information and to register, visit shorelinebaseball.com Team Connecticut Baseball will host early tryouts for Spring/Summer 2016 season for 12U and 13U players from 4-5:30 p.m. on Nov. 15 at Renegade Sports Center. The tryout is free. For more information visit ctheatbaseball.com . To sign up email ctheatbaseball@gmail.com or call (860) 449-4052. Team Connecticut Baseball will host early tryouts for Summer 2016 season for College Showcase Teams ages 15 and 16U and 18U players from 6-7:30 p.m.on Nov. 15 at Renegade Sports Center. For more information visit ctheatbaseball.com . To sign up email ctheatbaseball@gmail.com or call (860) 449-4052. The Eastern Connecticut State University baseball program will offer a clinic from 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. on Saturday, Jan. 23 at Geissler Gymnasium. High school players grades 9 through 12 are eligible to participate at a cost of $150 per clinic. For more information contact ECSU coach Matt LaBranche at (860) 465-4516 or labranchem@easternct.edu. Page 2 of 3 - BASKETBALL ONGOING Colchester Youth Basketball will hold a girls basketball conditioning program for players in grades 7-12. The program runs from 6 to 7:30 p.m. on Tuesdays and Thursdays through Nov. 19 in Gym B. Lisa LaSaracina will coach the program, which will consist of conditioning and games. Cost is $50. Register online at eteamz.com/colchesteryouthbasketball International Association of Approved Basketball Officials Eastern Connecticut Board 8 seeks candidates interested in becoming a high school official for the upcoming season. Candidates are strongly encouraged to attend the rules classes in preparation for the written exam on Monday, Nov. 2. Rules classes will be at the NFA cafeteria from 6 to 8:15 p.m. on Oct. 20, Oct. 27 and Oct. 29. For more information contact Mike Thomas at interpreter@iabbo8.org or (860) 912-6736 International Association of Approved Basketball Officials Northeast Connecticut Board 35 seeks candidates interested in becoming a high school official for the upcoming season. Clinics will be held at the high school from 6 to 8 p.m. on Oct. 20, Oct. 22, Oct. 27 and Oct. 29. A written exam will be at Killingly High at 6 p.m. on Nov. 2. For more information contact Peter Gerardi at my3sons76@charter.net or (860) 377-1068 COACHING VACANCIES ONGOING The Woodstock Academy girls basketball program is looking for a varsity assistant, junior varsity coach and freshman coach for the upcoming season. Interested applicants should send a letter of interest, resume, three letters of reference and a completed application, which can be found at http://www.woodstockacademy.org/cms/lib010/CT01903153/Centricity/domain/104/job %20postings/employapp.pdf, to associate headmaster Holly Singleton at hsingleton@woodstockacademy.org. FOOTBALL ONGOING The Eastern Connecticut Board of Approved Football Officials is looking for new male and female members for this season and beyond. Members must be over 18 years of age and pass the Connecticut Interscholastic Athletic Conference background check. Interested applicants can visit www.ecfo.org or email recruiting@efco.org to indicate interest, ask questions or download an application. LACROSSE AHEAD The Turkey Tourney girls lacrosse tournament is accepting registrations for 13-U, 15-U and high school teams. The tournament is Nov. 28 at East Lyme High School. Format is 5-on-5 plus goalies and cost is $350 per team. For more information, contact Phil Schneider at (860) 884-1980 or at phillip-schneider@att.net. The U.S. Coast Guard Academy Womenâ€™s Lacrosse Prospect Day and Clinic will be held on Sunday, Dec. 6. The event is open to female players in high school. Registration begins at 9:45 a.m., followed by a campus tour, lunch and clinic until 3:30 p.m. There is no charge. For more information contact Ruth Ness at ruth.g.ness @uscga.edu Page 3 of 3 - SOCCER ONGOING The Mendonca Soccer School is running a full-year player development program, Doca Futebol Academy. Training sessions will be run by coaches Joe Mendonca Sr., Joe Mendonca Jr. and Jen Sullivan in southeastern Connecticut communities. For more info or to try out, email mendoncasoccer@yahoo.com SOFTBALL ONGOING The CT Mirage 14-U Black team is looking for players. Players entering the ninth grade in September should email coach Brian Jacobs at coachjacobs23@hotmail.com The CT Challengers 14-U team is looking for players. For more info, call Randy Ortiz at (860) 942-3829 or email ranjames70@yahoo.com Stealth Fastpitch Softball 14-U team is looking for a few players born in 2000 or 2001 to complete the roster. If you are interested in playing competitive travel softball in a positive learning environment contact ctristealth@yahoo.com or visit www.stealthri.com for more information. To submit items to the sports calendar, email sports@norwichbulletin.com and include all pertinent information, as well as how long it is to run. There is no cost, and the calendar runs online every Monday and in print when space allows throughout the week. By The Bulletin
